_description: MCP tool response fixtures for medium claim case

adjuster_notes: Contractor (Apex Plumbing) installed new water line 3 weeks before failure
Pipe joint failed at connection point — likely installation defect
Server hardware amounts appear reasonable per market pricing
BI claim: 10 days at ~$11,800/day revenue. Company is a small MSP with 45 clients.
Data recovery costs documented with vendor invoice

endorsements.name: Electronic Data Processing
endorsements.description: Covers EDP equipment and media at replacement cost. No scheduled list required. Subject to BPP limit.

exclusions: Flood (standard) — note: internal plumbing failure is NOT flood
Faulty workmanship — applies to work performed BY the insured, not by contractors

conditions.subrogation_rights: Insurer reserves subrogation rights against responsible third parties

get_incident_report.source: Policyholder incident report with photos and plumber assessment
get_incident_report.origin: Server room, ceiling level — pipe joint failure at new connection
get_incident_report.cause_determination: Defective installation by Apex Plumbing. Joint was improperly soldered. Licensed plumber (independent) confirmed installation defect in written assessment.

damage_assessment_preliminary.structure: Minor — ceiling tiles and drywall. No structural damage.
damage_assessment_preliminary.equipment: 3 rack-mounted servers destroyed. 1 network switch, 2 UPS units damaged. All in server room directly below pipe.
damage_assessment_preliminary.inventory: No physical inventory. Data recovery from backup required.

repair_estimates.scope: Emergency data recovery from water-damaged drives
Server replacement, network equipment, rack, cabling, installation

coi_on_file.notes: COI active and valid at time of loss. Greenfield Data Solutions listed as additional insured. Strong subrogation target.

estimated_legal_costs.notes: Strong case — clear causation, active COI, additional insured endorsement. Demand letter likely sufficient.
